title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots might cut Stefon Diggs to save $16.8 million despite his connection with QB Drake Maye.
DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, and Kayshon Boutte are potential cuts, with Hollins saving the most cap space.
Linebacker Christian Elliss could be released to save cap, but roster depth and Jack Gibbens' status could influence decision.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play in the Celtics' Sunday game against the 76ers as he recovers from an Achilles injury.
Philadelphia 76ers' Joel Embiid is sidelined due to an oblique strain and will miss the next three games.
The Celtics, currently second in the East, have a 1-2 record against Philadelphia this season.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit two home runs in a Red Sox spring training game against the Twins, both against left-handed pitching.
Duran, traditionally struggling against lefties, shows improvement with a .583 average and three homers in 2026 spring training.
Despite offseason trade rumors, Duran may secure a lineup spot due to his strong spring performance, potentially as a designated hitter.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored 39 goals at Boston College this season, with Letourneau netting 19 as a sophomore.
Seven Bruins prospects played in the Boston College vs Boston University hockey game, showcasing Boston's rising talent pool.
The Bruins' strategic draft and trades have bolstered their prospect pipeline, with significant contributions from Hagens and Letourneau.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An unnamed NBA assistant coach views the Celtics as the favorites to win the Eastern Conference over the Pistons.
The Celtics hold a 39-20 record, trailing the 44-14 Pistons, but have shown strong performance since Thanksgiving.
Boston's high net rating and offensive strength contribute to confidence in their playoff potential despite the Pistons' defensive rating.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at Boston's Boch Center Wang Theatre on February 27, showcasing a mix of Americana influences.
The setlist included songs from Isbell's solo career, hits with the 400 Unit, and covers like The Rolling Stones' 'Can't You Hear Me Knocking'.
Isbell incorporated personal storytelling into his performance, addressing themes such as sobriety and personal loss with both electric and acoustic arrangements.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers Maxx Crosby, Trey Hendrickson, and Jaelan Phillips before NFL Draft.
Reports suggest Raiders expect at least two first-round picks for Maxx Crosby, amid speculation about his trade.
Patriots may focus on drafting an edge rusher; Missouri's Zion Young is a potential target with the 31st pick.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance set to buy Warner Brothers Discovery for $110 billion pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS may integrate sports content, enhancing MLB, NHL, and college football broadcasts.
NFL broadcasting rights could be reshaped as Netflix explores live sports options post-deal.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are interested in acquiring A.J. Brown, but his current asking price from the Eagles is too high.
Philadelphia would face significant financial implications if Brown is traded before June 1, suffering $44 million in dead money.
Brown, under contract through the decade, recorded 1,003 yards and seven touchdowns last season despite a less productive year.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts transitions E-ZPass from transponders to cost-effective RFID sticker tags starting Sunday, reducing production costs from $6.70 to 55 cents.
State estimates annual savings of $7.4 million with new sticker tags, eliminating the $20 transponder replacement fee for users.
Current E-ZPass transponders will remain functional; new stickers provided free for those replacing old transponders.
